DOC.brief_title: Calcineurin Inhibitor Avoidance With Thymoglobulin Sirolimus Kidney Transplantation
DOC.detailed_description: Calcineurin inhibitor-associated nephrotoxicity may exacerbate chronic allograft nephropathy reduce long-term kidney graft survival . Complete avoidance calcineurin inhibitor may improve graft function measure serum creatinine calculate GFR improve long-term outcome follow kidney transplantation . We conduct prospective , randomize , single-center study compare sirolimus versus tacrolimus kidney transplantation . Primary cadaver non-HLA identical living donor recipient randomize receive either sirolimus 5 mg QD ( target level 8-12 ng/ml ) tacrolimus 0.075 mg/kg BID ( target level 8-12 ng/ml ) . All patient also receive Thymoglobulin 1.5 mg/kg x 4 dos , mycophenolate 1 gm BID , prednisone . Main outcome measure patient graft survival , biopsy-proven acute rejection , serum creatinine , hyperlipidemia , post-transplant diabetes , surgical wound complication .
